item.title: Abortion ruling: US Supreme Court says leak is real as investigation launched
item.description: The leak has stirred expectations that the 1973 decision legalising US abortion could be overturned.

item.title: Russia beats final deadline to avoid debt default
item.description: Russia has drawn on US dollar reserves in order to make payments to international investors.

item.title: Ukraine war: Putin tells Macron West should stop sending arms
item.description: The Russian and French leaders speak by phone for the first time in more than a month.

item.title: Antytila: Ed Sheeran collaboration written on front line
item.description: Antytila, one of the biggest acts in Ukraine, are fighting Russian troops following the invasion.

item.title: Haiti 400 Mawozo gang leader extradited to US
item.description: Haitian authorities say leader of 400 Mawozo gang was extradited to the US for kidnapping Americans.

item.title: Russian mercenaries behind Central African Republic atrocities - HRW
item.description: Witnesses tell Human Rights Watch about summary executions, torture and the beating of civilians.

item.title: Missing Alabama guard and inmate had 'special relationship'
item.description: A massive manhunt is underway for murder suspect Casey White and guard Vicky White.

item.title: Shanghai: Authorities fire four officials after elderly patient blunder
item.description: A viral video shows an elderly patient being loaded into a hearse into a body bag.

item.title: People can now get contact info cut from Google search results
item.description: The web giant makes it easier to request that results linking to contact information are removed.

item.title: Óscar Denis: Former Paraguay VP's family marks his 600 days in captivity
item.description: Paraguay's ex-Vice President Óscar Denis is being held by EPP rebels who kidnapped him in 2020.

item.title: China building collapse: Two dead and more missing in Changsha
item.description: Nine people are rescued from the building which fell down on Friday but others are trapped inside.

item.title: Gay US student's killer jailed after 33 years
item.description: A Sydney man murdered the Cambridge University graduate at a gay cruising ground in 1988.

item.title: Roe v Wade: US women divided on leaked abortion ruling
item.description: Overturning the right to an abortion would be a major win for some. For others, a devastating loss.

item.title: The Indian couple who survived war and a hijacking at sea
item.description: While Akhil Reghu was being held captive by rebels in Yemen, his wife was trapped by war in Ukraine.

item.title: Oil prices have soared. Why won't Opec bring them down?
item.description: Oil prices are at an eight-year high, so why won't oil exporting countries bring them down?

item.title: Met Gala: 22 of the hottest looks from the 2022 red carpet
item.description: Gwen Stefani, Billie Eilish, Nicki Minaj and many more walked the red carpet at the New York event.

item.title: Why Europe will have to face the true cost of being in debt to China
item.description: The Beijing investment offers that need to be weighed up by European countries.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… Could Ukraine’s war spread to Moldova?
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why there is concern Moldova could be drawn into war, like its neighbour Ukraine.

item.title: Ukraine war: A 64-year-old Mariupol resident lost her home, but has nowhere to go
item.description: 64-year-old Tatyana is one of many Ukrainians who have lost their homes to Russian attacks.

item.title: Ukraine war: Nurse who lost her legs has first dance with husband in hospital
item.description: Oksana lost her legs, and four fingers, in a landmine explosion when returning home.

item.title: Met Gala 2022: Blake Lively, Kim Kardashian and others showcase lavish outfits
item.description: One of fashion's biggest events has rolled out the red carpet in New York for some of the world's stars.

item.title: Ukraine war: The southern villages holding back the Russians
item.description: Ukraine's south has seen heavy fighting as Russia seeks to take key port areas around the Black Sea.
